6.author: Affectionate_Dog2493
6.body:
Nope. Not that dedicated to improving & pathologically against being told what to do. If I was trying to improve I'd just spend more time watching my replays and not playing in ways I know are not optimal.

I know enough that if I wanted to look critically at my own gameplay I could identify all sorts of things I'm doing wrong and fix those before I need someone else to tell me which things I'm doing wrong that I'm not seeing.

I think coaches provide the most value to players that are either bad/new, but know the basics or are pretty good and looking to identify their blind spots. In the middle they're mostly only good for people who struggle being honest with themselves about their mistakes.

Most players could improve by just watching their own replays and being honest with themselves about their gameplay. It's easy to see things in review that you missed in game, especially when you can see way more information.

12.author: cam_caio
12.body:
muito muito bom o video, principalmente os pequenos detalhes do early/lane phase que são a diferenca total entre crescer no jogo ou ter dificuldadea analise da força/comp do seu time e dos adv tambem foi bem legal de ouvir, pequenas dicas (stick, pull atrás da torre, empurrar a wave adv se nao conseguir recuar, etc) tambem sao otimas. dica de posicionamento e nocao de tf tambem ajudam mt.

eu era ancient 2 e voltei apos 3 anos sem jogar, calibrei como lenda 2, praticamente mesma bracket do jugg analisado nesse video

se quiser demos pra analisar tambem, me avisa que te envio algumas minhas, só escolher se quer bons jogos ou jogos ruins. jogo principalmente de 4 ou 5, mas tenho varios jogos de carry e off tambem, só nao pego mid mesmo

Escolhe uma partida em que vc acha que não poderia ter feito nada de muito diferente. Ai um ponto de vista de outra pessoa nesses cenários é onde mais aprendemos!

17.author: Cena_0
17.body:
Dude the meta is stale because they are so strong that people can't pick off meta heroes anymore. people don't wanna deal with the same hero and have the same thing happen every single game they wanna play their favorite hero and enjoy the game how they want to. People don't wanna be forced to play or play against that one meta hero be it razor, Lina or damn clinkz. They don't wanna give up safe lane tower every game, they don't wanna be forced to pick a jungler carry every game or go triangle every game and they don't wanna smoke into silencer or clinkz every game or any other hero that is OP in that moment.

No matter what you think, 4 heroes getting double picked in one *phase* is ridiculous. You have a damn weird perception of what is stale and what is not.

17.author: Dominant-Species-Mid
17.body:
Which heroes are so strong that people can’t pick them off?!

The two main heroes people complain about are Razor and Lina and they’ve dropped to 50-53% winrate in most brackets which is meta but far far far from broken or OP.

If there is any one hero you are consistently losing too right now then you just suck and can’t adapt.

17.author: Cena_0
17.body: That's because people did adapt to them. My point still stands, you're either forced to counter pick them or pick them. The same shit every game but now people actually know how to deal with using the same hero or item they did last game. That my friend is what makes this patch so stale. I'm not losing. Hell, I'm on a 12 winstreak on clinkz but I wasn't enjoying the game anymore so I just quit to wait until new patch. In other words, I wanna pick Rubick or AA or something and not get destroyed everytime I pick them because the enemy support or carry scales better.

17.author: Dominant-Species-Mid
17.body: You are literally describing how the meta is still actively shifting and adapting which means it’s not stale lmfao

17.author: Cena_0
17.body: It's not about the actual meta heroes changing, let that sink in. It's about a few meta heroes being so broken that you're forced to play a specific way to adapt to them or just pick them. That's what's stale about it, it doesn't sound like a problem to you but it is to a lot of other people. You know what's not stale? A patch where 4 heroes don't get double picked. A patch where there's many meta heroes with many ways to deal with them.

18.author: phoenystp
18.body: Because those happen to be spells which use attackrange.

18.author: sheltergeist
18.body:
So they use all the attributes from right click but not evasion, why should it be like that?

I mean, no one argues these are spells, people just wonder why they have basically everything from right click including attack modifiers while completely omitting evasion mechanics

The explanation "they are simply spells" doesn't really explain anything in the first place, there are no technical restrictions for emulating the evasion effect the same way they emulate attack damage, range and modifiers

18.author: phoenystp
18.body:
Because spells don't care about evasion, it's as simple as that. Why they use attackrange and physical damage is precisely because whoever designed the spell decided they use those values. 

Does it make sense? Probably. Could they have just used a fixed or different value for range? Of course. But is it how it is and the spells are that they happen to be? I'd argue so.

18.author: sheltergeist
18.body:
All I'm saying spells are relatively new and the fact they have True Strike is far beyond intuitive. 

"Despite Burning Barrage's damage coming from the ability itself, it is still considered attack damage and not spell damage"

Not just physical, but attack damage, so it's nowhere near "simply a spell", it inherits more from attack logic than from spell logic

18.author: phoenystp
18.body: Sure, but if that's the design they choose what you gonna do? They would be the only spells which interact with evasion which is equally counter intuitive. So it happens to be the way it happens to be. Shouldn't matter though, you shouldn't be standing in that to begin with.

18.author: sheltergeist
18.body: We can also get back the Pudges hook with Chens teleport combo interaction because it was designed that way back then, and you shouldn't get hooked to begin with. True Strike on the spells was just implemented like that and wasn't ever fixed because it's not nearly as gamebreaking. Now it is just another exception players have to memorize

18.author: phoenystp
18.body:
>Now it is just another exception players have to memorize

No. There is simply no evasion for spells, there never was.

35.author: letsrazetheroof
35.body:
A 7k player can't carry from pos 3/4? I've won on pos4 reliably even at 2k mmr, 200 mmr should be a cakewalk. I'm not even flaming you - you legit have ZERO idea how easy it is if your game sense is that much higher. The only thing I can say is try to get into a herald lobby (some streamers do this) and you'll feel it's easier than default bots. There's zero game sense - as anyone >4k MMR, you won't even need to try (unless there's multiple smurfs).

You seriously overestimate how much griefers can do at this MMR. A 7k griefer KNOWS to buy wards, smokes, and also boots to feed mid. These guys literally afk trees to "grief" - they don't understand the game enough to block camps, etc.

Edit: More importantly, who will they feed? You can solo kill most heroes because of how bad they misplay (in most matchups)

35.author: trigeredasfuck
35.body:
1. you are not playing in europe.

2. you are only accounting true herald players without other smurfs

3. you underestime effect of how much harder is to carry solo dota in 2023 from non 1-2-3 pos

4. pos 4 can carry games but much harder than mid and you will still have wait for your allies to do something

5. i think its only you who is underestimating griefers here

6. as I said, with all of this taken into account most likely you will have win rate around 80% thrue out all games

7. 80% win rate which I stated, its not only thrue herald or guardian ranks, but thrue all ranks until divine, these 20% is simpy for things out of your control, not getting mid, griefers, smurfs, random discs, etc

35.author: letsrazetheroof
35.body:
1. I've played a lot in Europe, in fact I moved to Spain for 3 months and I've never had easier lanes. Macro game and team play is better, but individual skill falls off a cliff compared to SEA. At least at divine. Anyway, there's no way you're comparing Divine to Herald across servers :)

2. Nope. Other Smurfs would be 2-3k MMR, until the MMR inflation kicks in and you get +100/win. The matchmaker gave me 2x 2k MMR smurfs/game before a 4-5k one. Needless to say, multiple 2ks is still an easy win.

3. I don't. You haven't played in this bracket. I have, even as support (need those tokens). It's unloseable if I played my comfort pos3/4 picks (even on 5, you can play a 4). Hell, I even won as Pudge 5 iirc xD

4. No you don't need to wait - this sounds like someone who hasn't played in herald. I have taken tier 3 as Earth spirit before 20 minutes. You have NO IDEA what you're on about.

5-7. Irrelevant, you aren't understanding how easy it is. I had a feeder who wanted carry. He gave someone an Unstoppable spree my 8 minutes, I just killed that hero 3 times by 10/11 minutes. You just aren't understanding that they will die the same exact way back-to-back without realising their mistake. I didn't even smoke, I just walked up to his lane and used dream coil off CD. It's WAY too easy. They also stop feeding/griefing (usually) if you say you're a smurf. But you can just let them try to outfeed you - he literally couldn't feed as quick as I could kill (BoT + mobility, right?).

8. I get your point, but you aren't getting mine. The game will not match you against someone who can beat you before you end up climbing to guardian. You'll rise too fast for the game to realise you're THAT high in rank (7k). Eventually it'll taper down to 70-80%, true. But not within the first 1k MMR of your boosting journey.

35.author: trigeredasfuck
35.body:
> Macro game is better, teamplay is better, but individual skill is not

Im wondering how does this make sense in your head

38.author: johnkaye2020
38.body:
Pike won’t work against magic immune enemy (bkb) the same way her spells won’t work on magic immune enemy. Blink is not an escape tool, so she can use it to position but isn’t gonna help her when someone jumps her in the backline. Shadow blade can help but after the first time it’s only gonna be an inconvenience for the enemy. At higher mmr anyone targeting drow would carry dust on them if they have the space (once they notice you have invis)

For example, you’re fighting, anti mage jumps you, uses abyssal blade to stun you through your bkb, drains all your mana with his illusions, pops his own bkb so you can’t disable him, and he pretty much forces you to either retreat, die, or have your team members stop what they’re doing to peel, in which case he can blink away and cause havoc elsewhere.

38.author: ShickenButt
38.body:
you do make good points but still there are somethings to note, if someone uses bkb when jumping on drow, they won't have it when needed against other heroes especially supports with disables

while shadow blade is countered by dust most people in low brackets can fuck it up, but that's not that important. what's important about shadow blade is that people wont know where you are to jump on you and i believe that's the way people use it at high brackets

i find am vs drow really hard matchups for am since drow has low mana pool and doesnt dmg too much unless he's 6 slotted. correct me if I'm wrong but it feels like that for me

38.author: johnkaye2020
38.body: Was just using am as an example, I’m sure there are much worse matchups for her than him. Lifestealer maybe. But if I’m choosing between having a carry with bkb on cooldown, or a carry who’s dead, I’ll take the one with bkb on cooldown

38.author: ShickenButt
38.body: isn't carry with bkb on cd=dead carry tho XD everytime I'm against drow i let my mid or offlane take care of her if they cant i feel forced to do it(found lc good against her)

38.author: johnkaye2020
38.body: Yeah definitely think lc is good against her. And I mean yeah sometimes your team is better suited to take out the enemy carry than you are, but sometimes not. Even if you completely counter the drow they could have a support that counters you and then it doesn’t even matter. Dotas interesting like that. I mainly play offlane so I’d usually just play beast master and hit the enemy carry with a very long bkb piercing stun.

39.author: AkaneTempest
39.body:
Yes, mute everyone and play your own way. 

According to BSJ and all the other people my build (Willow Agh's first item) is literally griefing, didn't seem that way to me, 27 games and I was out of Herald. 

I don't think any of the advanced complex things matter in this bracket, we are all noobs, I just play the game, buy wards and try not to die, that's all. 

Hope that helps you if you are struggling too!

Are you solo stomping or kinda leading the team or following? 
I am 100% with you: in herald anything can work and there’s an own "meta"

39.author: AkaneTempest
39.body:
Well I don't mute anyone unless they show any sign of flaming, as soon the person tips someone, types something dumb in chat or tries to grief I'll mute + avoid at the end of the match. 

No those games weren't stomps, as you can see in the screenshot I averaged 11 kills 10 deaths, I was just another player in my team, trying to make the right callouts and just not die is all I did differently. 

After level 6 I just kept following my mid trying to gank someone, basically.

Thanks for your advice!

Bkb has longer CD than shadow realm, you don't need to prio bkb through damage over smother item progression. Just fish their bkb, you don't have to kill them during baby as willow mid. 

Also i read your comments here and other posts, you seem to have very narrow mindset. People are offering new things but you get all defensive and try to justify your suboptimal choices to people who has 3x MMR than you. Before getting all defensive and concluding you have the best idea how to perform with willow, you should listen and try what they try recommend.


I don't know you so this might be wrong irl but the image you represent here is not a good one, you ask for help but don't listen to answers is no good way to continue discussion. Try to understand what they are saying before getting all defensive and close your mind to input.

40.author: AkaneTempest
40.body:
Yeah I definitely agree on trying to learn a different hero when Willow is either banned or I get put against OD 😅 

I'm thinking about Void Spirit, he's a bursting hero that has escapes, I know everyone says he's bad in the patch but I don't really care about the meta, I think I can make anything work. 

Yeah, you are right when I see my mid Rubick buy Midas first item I get annoyed too, but I never grief or flame anyone. :/ 

Unfortunate, appreciate your insight!

40.author: AkaneTempest
40.body:
That's a very good piece of advice, thanks! 

You are right, I'm trying to force something that the hero is not good at, as soon the enemy pops BKB I just need to disengage and tell my team to run away, I'd have to say the damage with Daedalus is significant, not like one shotting people but yeah, the problem I notice is that I have 0 survivability, I will try getting a Witch Blade + Orchid instead of Daedalus, since both enable my hero more for what it's supposed to do (not damage through BKB) 

I'm probably underestimating Witch Blade yeah, I'm new to the game so I wouldn't know, I will take your advice and try games where I go more for a non brute force build, maybe even a Blink + Witch Blade instead of Daedalus. 

Reading your comment it has come to my attention that I'm trying to be the POS 1 carry in the game, so instead I should try to be a normal midlaner, aka building different items that aren't purely for damage purposes. 

Well, I get Tranquils since that's basically the way I have always done things, thanks to Shadow Realm I can safely stand behind tower not missing any CS, I don't try to even think about trying to harass my opponent other than denying creeps, not until I reach level 6, then I'll go for a kill instantly. 

I think Tranquils allow me to skip all the starting items, Tango, Bottle, Branches, etc for just 400 gold, if I went treads I would have to get regen so it wouldn't be just the 500 extra gold. 

My mid playstyle is just, CS until you are level 6 and then kill the enemy, I don't really play the way you are supposed to in mid lane, and when I have fought Tinker smurfs they keep trying to dive tower, so I just Shadow Realm and back off. 

Just explaining my reasoning, you definitely have more knowledge of the game than I do! Appreciate your insight I'll try it out for 10 games

40.author: AkaneTempest
40.body:
Hello. :) 

I don't think I have gotten defensive even once, I'm just trying to explain the reasoning behind all my item choices and Willow mid, I am absolutely trying to improve and have taken a few insights that will hopefully make me improve.

44.author: BlkWhiteSupremecist
44.body: Can you tell me where in your definition it says that? Because I just went through piece by piece and it doesn’t say water is wet.

44.author: Crimfresh
44.body:
I don't know if it's possible to be as stupid as you're pretending to be.  You're probably just a troll.  

1 a: consisting of, containing, covered with, or soaked with liquid (such as water) 

If a bucket has water.  It contains a liquid.  The bucket is wet.  A vagina is considered wet when covered with liquid.  A jacket is wet when soaked with liquid.  If something consists of liquid, it is also wet.  Are you really having that much trouble with one simple definition?  Stay in school buddy.

44.author: Crimfresh
44.body: Consisting of liquid.  Is water a liquid?  Stay in school bud.

44.author: BlkWhiteSupremecist
44.body:
haha it would be incredibly cringe if you're the average glue huffing dota player, projecting your own poor reading comprehension skills to try to belittle me; when in fact you're the one who can't read. But I know that doesn't describe you, and you must've simply missed my previous comment. 

Dictionary definitions:

**Composed:** (of elements) constitute or make up (a whole).

**Consist:** to be composed or made up of 

**Water:** a substance composed of the chemical elements hydrogen and oxygen and existing in gaseous, liquid, and solid states.

**Wet:** consisting of, containing, covered with, or soaked with liquid (such as water)

By definition, water is not composed of liquid. It is composed of gases. Therefore it is not wet, according to your own argument.

Please take the time to read and understand this comment before responding, even though it may take you a while :)

44.author: Crimfresh
44.body: Water is gas?  Damn you're a clown 🤡😂

50.author: Nordenfang
50.body:
The problem with this is short term vs long term. Yes the solution to women being in danger when alone at night isn’t just telling them not to do it at all(for that matter even dudes going out alone are at risk of being robbed or worse by armed people in certain parts of the world) but at the same time if you don’t listen to that what does that really do? Certainly it doesn’t solve anything. It’s rough but you have to deal with the world accordingly to how it is. That danger exists it isn’t going to magically go away any time soon so exercise caution.

That is the short-term individual scale solution.

Now of course it’s also a problem to leave it at that and just force the potential victims to adjust permanently so it’s also important for the people with the power to do things to implement change to address this issue. But this task cannot be done by individuals it has to be done institutionally through good policing or through communities like volunteer night watch.

Same thing for the kid being bullied. In the short term have them avoid the kids that bully them and the things that get them bullied because sending them out there all gung ho because “you shouldn’t have to be the one to adjust as the victim” is all sunshine and rainbows in an ideal world but practically it doesn’t do anything but let the kid keep getting bullied. As with the women being in danger the critical part here is to not just leave it at that but also, at the same time as teaching the kid what to do to avoid the bullying, contact the people with the power to do things such as the administration, or the bullies parents etc etc and inform them of the situation and implore them to make a move. Cause you as the parent(let’s say) don’t have much power to affect what the bullies at school are going to do to the kid so you have to rely on the ones who can or remove the kid from the environment if that doesn’t work. 

Now circling back to this actual situation. The short term solution that you can implement on an individual level is to just mute them because nothing you say is going to change these people’s behavior it’s infinitely more likely to energize them more to increase their harassment cause they get a response. So what does forcing yourself to listen to that crap really do at the end of the day?

Long term solution here is to rely on those with actual power to do anything(game developers/whoever’s in charge of banning accounts I’d imagine) with the report button OR get some sort of community movement going to implore the devs to implement something that makes weeding out misogyny/toxicity easier.(though this one is vastly harder than just relying on the report button obviously). 

Alternatively MAYBE you could fight fire with fire and do some sort of thing where you and a group of people will harass back anybody who harasses people over stupid misogynist shit but this is an uphill battle(there’s a lot of assholes in the world you’re outnumbered) and it isn’t sustainable(a lot more taxing on you than it is for the asshole).


Basically what I’m saying in a very long-winded way is there’s nothing wrong with using the short term solution of just muting. Not muting and engaging with these people does nothing but invite trouble for yourself, as someone who’s been in numerous internet spitting matches it really doesn’t work to change anything it just tires you out.(and that’s just for normal shit. I imagine it’d be even worse for deeply rooted misogynist shit). It’s just critical to ALSO go for some long term action here. Report’s probably the easiest one to go for as far as that’s concerned)although efficacy is questionable).

Both. Both is good.

Anyway just my two cents I shall return to the shadow realm from whence I came.(usually just a lurker on here lmao)

50.author: s---laughter
50.body: Wait, I'm not telling anyone to recklessly assert themselves like a woman going out alone at night because she should be able to. That's just dumb. But unless the girl is a minor who's still growing up and learning about the world, I'm not going to physically tell a grown ass woman, who is complaining to me about how the world feels dangerous to her, to "just don't go out at night." That's a 100% way to let her know I'm not interested in her struggles and that I'm fine with the world as it is while enjoying my privileges.

50.author: Nordenfang
50.body: I see so you’re more against the attitude with which people say, “just mute” in this thread? And not the advice itself? Cause I do think there’s nothing inherently wrong with suggesting that OP mute people instead of doing what she describes in the post for all the reasons I mentioned in my last comment.

50.author: s---laughter
50.body: Yeah. It's the dynamics. Like what black and white people should say when a black person complains about racism. Both can reply with empathy and solidarity. But only one can say "just stay away from white areas" or "just don't mind them". Black people can say it because they are rarely in the place to be able to do anything. White people can't because they're the one's in power and it cannot be compared to "I have fights with other white people too." There is something inherently wrong if a white person says it. It's something that comes with maturity and something I took a while to understand too.

50.author: Nordenfang
50.body:
Idk I think there’s nothing wrong with a white person saying “just stay away from white areas” so long as it’s not said in that manner. But the meaning would be the same anyway, only communicated in a way that implies less dismissal of the black person’s problems. 

If your issue is only with phrasing and tone I can get behind that. As much as possible people should endeavor to communicate tactfully but if you disapprove of not simply the phrasing but the meaning itself that is being conveyed coming from a specific type of person then that’s where I’d have to disagree tbh.

At the end of the day it comes from a place of goodwill. The advice of muting is saying “I want you to be able to avoid this terrible unfair issue and thus I am suggesting a good way for that to happen.” And as previously discussed the critical part for this to not be complacency in a position of privilege is the long term part which comes into play through other methods. 

And to go back to the dynamics issue, am I, as a dude, not allowed to advise my sister against going out alone at night simply because I am a man and thus part of the demographic that has a tendency to oppress my sister’s demographic?

Idk I think there’s more nuance to navigating power dynamics than simply “Member of Group A can’t say X things to Member of Group B”

50.author: s---laughter
50.body:
>so long as it’s not said in that manner

There is no manner. I don't have an issue with phrasing, or tone. Doesn't matter how well meaning it is said. It shouldn't be said.

>“I want you to be able to avoid this terrible unfair issue and thus I am suggesting a good way for that to happen.” 

You normalized thinking actions that involve the oppressed adjusting to the oppressor is a "good way." That's why the absence of an active action seems like goodwill.

>am I, as a dude, not allowed to advise my sister against going out alone

It is your responsibility, as an older brother, to teach your little sister about the world like a black parent is to a black child. It is not your responsibility, as a man, to tell any grown adult woman your age what to do and what not to do when they complain to you about the struggles of women. It is your responsibility as a man, to check yourself, your friends, and the people you have influence over, to make sure you maintain an environment that is safe for women.

50.author: Nordenfang
50.body:
I misspoke. When I say good way I simply mean a practical way. As I said with the previous comment in an ideal world this wouldn’t be the case but we have to be realistic. Yes the oppressed shouldn’t have to be the one to adjust to the oppressor but that’s the reality we live in and it’s okay to acknowledge that and give advice accordingly because really nobody has the individual power to do anything about it. All we can do is try in whatever small ways we can to contribute to getting something done about it. That includes what you say about checking myself and the people I hold influence over but I see no reason why these things have to clash with the giving of the aforementioned practical piece of advice. Both can be done. 

And I don’t think describing well-meant advice as “telling a grown ass woman what to do and what not to do” is a very charitable way to look at it.

Personally unsolicited advice is not something I think people should be giving out willy nilly but in a case of personal connection to someone like a friend I think it is every person’s responsibility to look out for their friend in whatever way they can including the giving of advice when they may encounter a particular situation. Especially if you are witnessing them act against that to their own detriment. 

To go back to the example of a woman going out at night if someone I know and care about intends to go out alone late at night it would be irresponsible of me as their friend to let it happen. Even if they were a complete stranger, concern would be warranted if you witness someone doing such a thing and naturally you would say something about it to the effect of “don’t do this”. 

To apply it to the subject matter of this post, I can see that OP is willfully subjecting herself to people’s harassment by not using the mute function. Out of a concern for a fellow human being I would advise against it for the previously mentioned reasons and I don’t think there’s anything wrong with that just as there wouldn’t be anything wrong with telling a stranger not to go out alone at night when you witness it happening, knowing what could happen to them.

Idk I really can’t wrap my head around how it’s a bad thing to caution people against acts you think might be unhealthy or bad for them regardless of power dynamics. You can do that AND at the same time act in a way to fight against complacency within that system. Both are net goods that avoid bad things happening to other people.

53.author: w8eight
53.body: I can show you a pros (well now retired) that are using overwolf in pubs. Would that change your mind? Because I see, that you need me to provide one specific example, without any deviation, to convince you. But guess what, that specific examples don't exist. I don't have hidden cameras in pro dota player houses, so i obviously can't see what they are doing in pubs, but i can't see them during pro games. Which are just dota games. And i can see them using historical data about enemies, because they know their id in advance. Hell, they even track their smurfs, not only main accounts.

53.author: Chillionaire128

54.author: _NINESEVEN
54.body:
Teams from Europe have won 7/11 TIs, but what percentage do they make up Historical Top 4's? 

In the NFL, it is very unlikely that the MVP for a given year also wins the Superbowl. It's the same in Dota -- it's unlikely that the best player in the world that year *also* wins TI just due to pure probability. There's a much higher chance that they are somewhere between 2nd and 4th, or even 2nd and 8th.

Not only that, while /u/Filthy_Joey only listed 8/10 players, it's telling that they listed 6 players playing in WEU + Sumail, who made his bones in NA but has played in WEU for years now. The idea that one single Chinese player (much less other countries outside of WEU) comes up when they thought of their top 8 players of all time is telling.

54.author: LILwhut
54.body:
They mentioned 8 players, 6 from EU, 1 from NA, 1 from China. With two slots open. 

7 TIs for EU, 3 for China, 1 for NA. If the two open slots go to Chinese players it lines up almost perfectly.

Considering how dominant EU have been recently it's easy to see why EU players come more clearly to mind.

54.author: _NINESEVEN
54.body: Again, China has won 3/11 TIs and is well-represented in the historical Top 8 at TI. It would be incredibly improbable that only a single Chinese player is in the Top 8 players of all time.

54.author: LILwhut
54.body:
It isn't the top 8 it's 8 out of top 10 in no particular order.

And it really isn't that improbable considering that even during their peak, China wasn't that much better than the west, if at all. Whereas EU has been dominating the last 4-5 years.

There's been 11 majors with EU only finals. 3 TIs with EU only finals. Top 3 for most major wins are all EU teams. Top 2 on second places in majors are all EU teams too + 1 tied for 3rd. EU teams have won 17 out of 25 majors (probably would have won more if not for 2020 cancelations).  

There have been 0 majors with CN only finals. 1 TI with CN only finals. 2 out of top 5 most major wins are CN but just barely. 1 team in top 5 for second places in majors. CN teams have won just 6 out of 25 majors.  

It should be no surprise that EU players make up most of a top 10 players list.
